response.component: The death penalty should be abolished because it is inhumane and ineffective as a deterrent.
Capital punishment violates the fundamental human right to life and dignity.
Numerous reports have documented cases where innocent people were executed due to flaws in the judicial system.
Executions are often carried out in a manner that causes prolonged suffering, which can be considered a form of torture.
The death penalty does not effectively reduce crime rates.
Studies have shown that regions with capital punishment do not have lower homicide rates than those without it.
Criminals often act in the heat of the moment or without expecting to be caught, so harsh punishments donâ€™t deter them.
